title: Their Eyes Were Watching God - Janie at the end

content.prompt: Which of the following best describes Janie at the end of the passage?

choices.label: She is about to become a recluse after having seen the world's foolishness.
She feels free from social constraints and confident about the future.
She remains bitter about her childhood but she is now able to forgive.
She is determined to ignore the intervening years and be childlike again.

skill.text: Skill 1.B: Explain the function of a character changing or remaining unchanged.
